The Air Accidents Investigation Branch (AAIB) report details the events leading up to the crash of the Hawker Hunter jet on August 22nd. Cockpit footage shows the pilot, Andy Hill, making control inputs as the aircraft responded to his commands. However, it remains unclear whether Hill initiated his ejection, as he was thrown clear of the aircraft during the later stages of the crash. The 51-year-old pilot is currently in a serious but stable condition in a hospital. The report reveals that the Hawker Hunter's canopy was released at the initial impact, which resulted in the release of fuel and fuel vapor. These substances then ignited, causing the jet to split into four parts and ejecting both Hill and his seat from the cockpit. The investigation is ongoing to determine whether Hill attempted to initiate his ejection or if the canopy and pilot's seat were freed as a result of impact damage to the cockpit. Further information from the AAIB report suggests that there was no evidence of any malfunction or system failure that may have contributed to the crash. This suggests that the incident was caused by human error, possibly due to a lack of proper training or inadequate cockpit procedures.
